releases.title: The Ecclesiastical Tapes
releases.coverArtAlt: Two robed figures playing instruments at sunset with apocalyptic skies and inexplicable shepherds' staffs
releases.description: We found religion. Or maybe the whiskey finally found us. Either way, we traded our bar stools for shepherd's staffs and recorded seven tracks that answer the eternal question: 'What if prophets, but make it rock?' Features 100% more robes than our previous work. May contain traces of actual musical competence. Light that dumpster fire and join us for the most confusing career pivot since that time we tried yacht rock.

tracklist.title: Amen (We Think That's How It Ends)

releases.title: Release the Kraken!
releases.coverArtAlt: Release the Kraken album cover featuring a dark kraken emerging from a whiskey bottle
releases.description: Our magnum opus. Eleven tracks of pure, unfiltered rock absurdity. We spent literally tens of dollars on this production.

releases.title: Basement Tapes Vol. 1: The Lost Sessions
releases.coverArtAlt: Basement Tapes album cover with vintage cassette tape aesthetic
releases.description: Recorded on equipment we found in a dumpster. Seven tracks of raw, unpolished chaos from our humble beginnings. Lo-fi before it was cool.

releases.title: Live at The Empty Room
releases.coverArtAlt: Live album cover showing an empty dive bar with a single microphone stand
releases.description: Our most intimate performance. Literally just us. The bartender left halfway through. Recorded on someone's phone. Peak authenticity.

tracklist.title: That Song Everyone Requested (But Nobody Came)

releases.title: The Whiskey Sessions
releases.coverArtAlt: EP cover featuring an empty whiskey glass and scattered guitar picks
releases.description: Four tracks, forty takes, fourteen bottles. An EP that captures the essence of bad decisions and good intentions. Surprisingly coherent for the circumstances.
